name: Symbaroum - The Ambrian Struggle
desc: The adventures of Garibald, Greg, Jay, Purah, Ripley, and Vento in Symbaroum.

sessions.desc:
Intro: And so Alberetor fell, forcing Queen Korintha and her people north over the Titans mountains to Davokar's edge. Here Ambria was built, next to the Barbarian settlements that were scattered throughout the Davokar forest. Rejected by all who claim Davokar their home, the Ambrians are seen as intruders to the land by both the Elder Folks and the local Barbarians. With the threat of the Dark Lords and their hordes of corrupted undead, diplomacy and peace between the living races is the needed path for all civilizations inhabiting the land to survive. Unable to return home or rid the land of the corruption, Queen Korintha gathers her strength and seeks new options to help her people and power grow. Symbaroum, an ancient civilization which once spanned all the realm, now lays in ruin as nature and the corruption slowly take hold. Desperate for any of the secrets kept deep within the Davokar forests that might help return the Dark Lords to their slumber, Queen Korintha sends expedition after expedition into Davokar in hopes of finding their salvation. It is south of the Titans mountains that we start our journey, in the once beautiful lands of Alberetor. Two decades after Queen Korintha had been freed from the Dark Lords grasp. Year 21. 

Key events and points of interest:
- Keller has been saved and allowed to travel with the group to Yndaros.
- Lebun and Ludo were offered to the Elves to pay for their crimes, who attempted to flee and became corrupted.
- Gained favor with Argasto the traveling merchant and the Iron Pact for assisting them.
- Experience points gained this session 15, total 65 plus 5exp per burden. 4 burdens max.
sessions.name: Session #1 - The Promised Land

sessions.desc:
Intro: Yndaros, the city of the queen, stands tall over the golden plains of Prios. Large stone towers reach for the heavens while people toil and wonder through the streets. Known not only for its art, but also for the many wonderous markets, Yndaros offers much to the wealthy and privileged. Around you stands a sea of refugees, near 20,000 people who fled the corrupted lands of Alberetor. To the north lay the slums of the city while to the west the great gladiatorial Dome stands ready for any brave enough to fight. The sun sits at its highest point while priests, city guards, and Black Claoks comb through the refugee camp in search of any blight marked individuals. It is here that you continue your journey. Here your fate is decided. 

Key events and points of interest: 
- Rejected Vargus' offer to join his research endeavor.
- Saved Tenid from the Black Cloaks who fled in fear.
- Gained suspition at the Witch and Familiar Inn along with the favor of the traveling bard Hans.
- Found the hidden ruins using familiar tracking.
- Killed Gorak the undead.
- Successfully caught the Flyer, whose real identity is Alahara, alive and turned her into the town's watch. Her goal to save Gorak from the suffering undeath by sacrificing human organs to remove permanent corruption.
- Favor gained with Ordo Magika, but lost a little due to over negotiating the reward.
- Learned about the legend of the Copper Crown, worn by an old king of Symbaroum, which curses any who touch it to slowly become corrupted.
- Learned about the expeditions sent by both Thistlehold and Ordo Magika into the Davokar forests in search of the Tomb of Dying Dreams. All contact has been lost with the teams when Lebun and Ludo died, until Alahara was captured and exposed as still alive.
- Baulmelo's hunt for blight mark and dark sorcerers still continues.
- Rumors of an uprising is spreading through Ambria, spoken by the devoted Church of Prios' priests and templars.
Total experience points gained is 8 this session. Added one for the successful survival as you crossed Prios. Total experience per character should be 73 plus 5 for each burden, max 4 burdens.
sessions.name: Session #2 - The Mark of the Beast
Session #3 - The Lost Ruins of Hargrin
sessions.desc:
Intro: News of the Flayers capture has spread quickly through Thistle Hold, providing a great deal of order and peace to the people. Still Ambria is plagued by the Blight Born and even with the Flayer's death there only seem to be more reports of attacks along the north edge of Ambria. The church of Prios preach of cleansing the land while templars hunt for any marked by the corruption. Even with Ordo Magica, originally a research institute, has been training and enlisting Beast Slayers to help protect the land. As the group gathers in the Ordo Magica Tower in Thistle Hold, a flustered and rather annoyed looking group of Black Cloaks enter the tower. The goblin doorkeeper has been pushed aside and restrained by the Black Cloaks. It is here you continue your journey. 

Points of interest and key events:
- Purah has disappeared along with the skull.
- Baulmelo has decided to go search for the skull himself.
- Ira, from Ordo Magica, has requested you investigate the ruins of the long dead fallen Symbar, King HurianLo-Apak, where they lost contact with their expedition.
- Learned of the legend of the Great Hunt. A story told by many treasure hunters and Barbarians of a giant white sow, Gylta, that roams the southern land of Davokar, chased by the winter elf known as the Eternal Hunter.
- Found Salvindar's Hope, a treasure excavation site of the old King Salvindar's tomb.
- Vento has seen visions of an elven woman that speak of a wounded boar that protects the land.
- The entrance to a partially buried tomb was found nearby Salvindar's Hope. Inside many strange mystic writings and experiments were found, along with a nearly famished winter elf.
- Greg has removed the sword Giant's Bane from the shrine which has summoned a great wolf who came and devoured the winter elf before leaving the ruins.
- A sorcerer was also found locked within the ruins who attacked without provocation. Vento managed to recognize the sorcerer as Vargus from the refugee camp in Yndaros before he escaped.
- Experience gained was 8 plus 4 so 12.
- Total experience to date would be 50 + 15 + 8 + 12 = 85 exp plus 5 times the number of burdens.

sessions.name: Session #4 - Salindra's Hope
sessions.desc:
Intro: A storm brews overhead while the walls of Hargrin's Tomb shake and tremble around you. Howls, clicks, and various other unidentifiable noises emitnate from the dark forests of Davokar. Your journey continues here, just north of Salvindra's Hope, within the entrance hall of The Giant Slayer Hargrin. Your hunt for the great sow fruitless, but your thirst for loot quenched momentarily. With the location of King HurianLo Apak's tomb still a mystery along the Malgomor river, the group of explorers push further into the great forest in hope of finding fortune, fame, power, and glory.

Key points of interest:
- Attacked by Iron Pact Rangers attempting to preserve the Davokar forest 
- Gained favor of Senrer, the great wolf of Hargrin the Giant Slayer 
- Rejoined with Garibald and part of his fellow Ambrian rebels
- Encountered the great spirit guardian, Gylta the White Sow, who had been injured by a spear and was being attacked by native Barbarians
- Saved Gylta from the Barbarians, but badly wounded her with the spider artifact which revealed the severe level of corruption Gylta had accumulated 
- Experience gained this session was 4exp
- Total experience thus far should be 89exp plus 5 per burden, max 4 burdens

sessions.name: Session #5 - The Journey to the Ordo Magica Outpost
sessions.desc:
Intro: As Gylta runs deeper into Davokar and the sun sets, your group is left with nothing but the cold embrace of the fierce winds. Nearly ten days have passed since you left Thistle Hold and entered the forests. Four days since you found Salindra's Hope and the ruins of Hargrin the Giant Slayer was excavated. Having calmed the great wolf Senrer and heeding his words of warning, the group travels further northwest in search of HurianLo Apak's tomb. No signs of the Eternal Hunter to be found, besides the spear which was pulled from Gylta's side by the mystic arts of the trolls spoken by Jay. It is within Davokar that you continue your story, here your paths are made.

Points of interest and key events:
- Found Purah lying in the forest with no memory of how she arrived.
- Pushed further north until you encountered the wondering Palidans, Sigard and Leo, who showed allegiance to the Duke of Ambria, Korinthia's uncle. 
- Was attacked by Barbarians in the night who were defeated and a single survivor captured, interrogated, and imprisoned by the group.
- Found the Ordo Magica outpost next to the Malgomor river which looked to be in a state of ruin.
- Found two Ordo Magica apprentice survivors in the central cabin.
- Was attacked by Blood Cats from all angles
- 19 days have passed since you left Thistle Hold
- Earned exp 4, total 93 exp plus 5 per burden.  Max 4 burdens.

sessions.name: Session #6 - Through the Dead Forest
sessions.desc:
Intro: Over two weeks have passed since you left Thistle Hold, the dangers of Davokar slowly depleting your resources and wearing on your health. Having found the outpost of Ordo Magica's expedition, the group was attacked by wild cats which split up the group as Greg and Purah raced off to find Pumba and their hostage. The wild cats were able to kill the hostage Barbarian taken by the group, but Pumba was saved due to your efforts. Leading the wild cats back to the outpost, the group was able to remove the aggressors from the field with ease and continue your journey in search of King HurianLo Apak's Tomb.

Key points of interest and events:
- Successfully defended the Ordo Magica apprentices.
- Learned of another expedition outpost lost in the Dead Forest.
- Found the apprentices trying to take back the head of an Ordo Magica rogue sorcerer known as Gardin the Fickle.
 - Allowed the apprentices of Ordo Magica to leave without the head of the rogue sorcerer.
- Went exploring through the Dead Forest in search of the second lost Ordo Magica outpost lead by the ever vigilant Ripley.
- Encountered a deactivated giant golem that appeared to have scorch Mark's around the visible legs and arms.
 - Found the lost outpost which had been over run by some corrupted force and wild goblins.
- Defeated Bigpaw and Njegg, along with their body guards and rage troll.
- Found an imprisoned cleric who seemed at his wits end.
- Experience gained this session, 6 exp
- 21 days total have passed since you left Thistle Hold
- Earned exp 6, total 99 exp plus 5 per burden. Max 4 burdens.

sessions.name: Session #7 - The Lost Outpost of Ordo Magica
sessions.desc:
Intro: A fierce wind blows into the abandoned and ruined Ordo Magica outpost, the corpse riddled field all that is left among the wooden sheds and the collapsing stone tower. The goblins and rage troll slain within the tower and little to be found among the ruins but a cleric. Over joyed at his release, but barely able to string two words together, he tells a tale of giant white glowing creature that crawled down from the heavens on rays of light to save him from the darkness. He alone survived the darkness that took his entire outpost. However, the cleric's savior left him undefended against the goblins and their troll. Suppressing the trauma that was his life as a poorly feed prisoner, the cleric Tonsel offers his help in any way he can to the group. Do not hesitate to ask.

Key Events and Points of Interests:
- Invited Tonsel to accompany the group as you continue your search for King HurianLo Apak's tomb.
- Found the sinkhole which was easily climbed.
- Encountered the great spider Xanatha and accepted her offer for protection against the darkness in exchange for the Vile water, all except Greg.
- Was shown a underground path to King HurianLo Apak's tomb where hordes of giant spiders filled the tunnel.
- Found the tomb of the fallen king and collasped the tunnel to prevent spiders from following.
- Encountered the Thorn Queen, a giant corrupted creature with eight limbs, and lulled it to sleep in order to enter the throne room of the tomb.
- Fought and defeated the revengeful spirit of King HurianLo Apak, claiming his treasures for your own and removing the curse from Purah.
- Experience gained this session, 9 exp.
- Total experience is 108 plus 5 exp per burden.

sessions.name: Session #8 - The Tomb of King HurianLo Apak
sessions.desc:
Intro: As the darkness creeps into King HurianLo Apak's Tomb, the walls shake and the floor cracks open. Stone and debris fall from the ceiling as the Thorn Queen attempts to enter the Throne Room. Hordes of small corrupted looking spiders swarm up between the cracks with menacing pincers clicking wildly. Here you fight for your spoils and life.

Key points of interest and key events:
- Escaped the tomb without any deaths of party members.
- Defeated one of the appendages of the Thorn Queen.
- Ran past all glowing suits of armor which sprang to life and began attacking all who entered.
- Encountered Vargus at the entrance of the tomb where he setup an ambush.
- Gained 4 exp this last session.
- Total experience 112 plus 5 per burden, max 4 burdens

sessions.name: Session #9 - The Escape from King HurianLo Apak's Tomb
sessions.desc:
Intro: Heavy rain pours down from the darkening sky. Vargus stands down the muddy road leading away from King HurianLo Apak's Tomb. The fog of darkness could be seen seeping through the tomb's cracks. Loud shrieks could be heard coming from deep within the tomb. Lightning flashes in the distance and the faces of angry and muddy looking mercenaries reveal themselves from behind the surrounding trees. A moment of silence follows before Vargus grins and hurls a bolt of black lightning at Ventos. Roll for initiative!

Points of interest and key events:
- Encounter with Vargus and his mercenaries where Vento, Greg, and Garibald were nearly killed.
- Saved by Xanatha at the last moment which sent Vargus and his remaining force running.
- Jay upheld his end of the pact with Xanatha and gave the vile water to her, but Xanatha was convinced by Vento that she should not drink it.
- Xanatha told of the Ruined City of Odaban where the sacred water resides that will neutralize the Vile water.
- With the darkness still slowly creeping out of King HurianLo Apak's tomb the group sets off towards the Malgomor river in hope's of leaving the dead forest in one piece.
- With Greg leading the group through the forest, the group finds a good resting place among what little live nature is still left within the woods.
- All players are now fully healed.
- 2 experience points earned this session
- Total 114 experience plus 5 per burden, max 4 burdens

sessions.name: Session #10 - The Escape from King HurianLo Apak's Tomb
sessions.desc:
Intro: After a full night's rest within the Desd Forest you find that the darkness has crept through the woods leaving long grey strieks of decay in its path. You all cough heavily and find it hard to breathe. Dark clouds still hang overhead, the rain pouring down periodically but never leaving completely. Strange blackened vines crawl over the ground and up the trees, seeming to squeeze the breathe out of forest. To the northeast mountains can be seen along with the remains of the abandoned order Magica outpost tower. Here you choose your path.

Points of interest and key events:
- Continued traveling west where corrupted animals were found that seemed to explode with bile and black sludge.
- Had supplies stolen from Jay and Greg, but no culprit was found. Only humanoid like footprints that lead to a strange fox statue.
- A riddle was etched on the fox statue which was solved by the team to reveal the entrance to a dark tunnel.
- Instead of risking life and limp the group choose to wade through the river to where bonfires and tents could be seen north of the Malgomor river.
- Ripley parted ways with the group and ventures forth into Davokar to learn and live among nature.
- North of the river the group encountered Barbarian rangers who allowed only select trusted players into their encampment based on persuasive tactics and demonstrations of strength.
- Within the encampment the group spoke to the elder Witch who was placed in charge while the chieftain and his elite warriors were still away.
- The encampment of Barbarians had traveled from the far north of Davokar, forced out of their land by a neighboring Barbarian clan, Gaioa Clan, who had burned down their homes and slain most of their people.
- Greg hired a rather charismatic mercenary known as Lacey Thatcher, after several tries of haggling.
- Jay won a blacksmithing competition gaining fame
- Vento met a goblin by the name of Fenric, an Ambrian Treasure Hunter who had his treasure hunter license stolen, told of the children of the Earth Towers. Those wild being who wear animal masks and act as if they were that animal. They were young children, taken at birth, who were raised by the lords of the Earth Towers and forced steal from any passing adventurer to pay off their debt to the tower lords. Or so the legend goes...
- The group passed into a dreamless sleep, their exhaustion near too great to bare with the comfort of the furs and warmth of the fires.
- 1 experience point gained
- Total 115 experience plus 5 per burden, max 4 burdens.

sessions.name: Session #11 - The Children of the Earth Towers
sessions.desc:
Intro: With a full night's rest the group awakens to the rising sun light which can barely make it's way through the thick trees and strange ruins of Davokar. News of the chieftains death spread quickly through the camp with the return of the sole surviving elite Wrath Warden, his armor torn and face beaten. Many of the Barbarian campers have decided to part ways, some traveling northeast while the rest continue south to their Barbarian brothers and sisters. Here Juwei, the Witch of the dead chieftain Gorren, asks you for your help to travel north to where Yinra resides. Her swamp will prove a difficult journey, but one which she believes you can handle. Here you make your choice.

Points of interest and key events:

- Purah and Garibald decided to travel by themselves to Karvosti to meet the others.
- Vento, Greg, and Jay declined Juwei's offer, the Witch of the northern Barbarians, to escort them north to the Blackpitch Mire swamps.
- Leaving the Barbarian encampment that had mostly dispersed, the group traveled southwest along the river in search of good trees to make a boat.
- The group lost loot to the masked wild children, managing to capture one before she was able to leave. After some interrogating the group learned that the masked children speak an old strange dialect of troll, with many of the words missing. Knowledge of the Earth Towers were shared, along with the Enternal War that rages on underneath the shifting mountains led by the Lords of the Rift.
- Jay successfully chopped down an oak tree from a safe area of Davokar and made a boat.
- After one day if travel by water the group goes to rest and watches in horror as their wild rabbit masked captive starts to decay once she touches the ground. Her life gone within the hour.
- The group then followed the river in their boat for about a day until they were attacked by a large ancient creature who Lacey identified as the creature from the an old Barbarian myth involving a great hero who became mad and ate a neighboring princess who was to be his betrothed. With his own kin calling for his head, the mad Barbarian swam into lake Voloma and sank to the bottom where he remains to this day. Forever changed by the madness.
- Having escaped the sea creature's grasp, the group hiked through the thick forest of Davokar until they find the Earth Towers themselves.
- Before exploration of the towers could happen, a Treasure Hunting troll by the name of Rityr comes running out of the closest earth tower mound followed by undead.
- After fighting off the majority of undead the group helps and questions Rityr who agrees to help where he can.
- Rityr explains that he was searching for Troll artifacts in the Earth Towers to reclaim for his people. He says the lords of the Earth Towers have been here for many years, perhaps before Symbaroum was founded. He tells of endless battles occurring underground where the lords fight for control of the Earth Towers and their secrets.
- In the middle of the night Rityr leaves the group in a hurry to return to the Sun Temple to meet a priest. He says he will travel to Karvosti after his business is settled.
- On the next morning the Earth Towers have changed location and the group decided to explore one tower for any signs of loot. Nothing found within the strange room of the earth mound, a sorry excuse for a tower.
- Experience gained this session 3exp
- Total experience gained is 118 plus 5 per burden max 4.
